chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Aron F. Fogleson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Clark County Case No. 15CF94.
Consecutive to: Jackson County Case No. 12CF71.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain employment.   Not to terminate employment without the agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle until properly licensed and insured.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with K.D.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Associated with Charge #3

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Plead to count 3.  Counts 1 & 2 DRI.  Joint recommendation for 3 years probation consecutive to 12CF71.  I&S.   18 Mo.  , ES.  concurrent with Clark County Case.  Victim notification complied with.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he is pleading to.  Defendant understood.  Defendant plead guilty.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Felony warnings given.   Defendant understood.  Repeater allegation confirmed by the court.   Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Count 3. Counts 1 and 2, dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes..  Joint recommendation for 3 years probation consecutive to any sentence now serving.  Impose and stay 18 Mo. initial confinement,  24 mo.   extended supervision,  concurrent with Clark County Case no. 15CF94.    Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with K.D.  AODA  o/m employment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.    Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly licensed.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld,  3 years probation consecutive to 12CF71, concurrent to 15CF94.  Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with K.D.  AODA and recommended treatment.  Obtain and maintain employment.   Not to terminate without agent approval.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.    Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly licensed and insured.  CC & DNA surcharge.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-04-2016 10:00 am
Information filed with Court.  Waive reading of information.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by court.  Set for plea/sentencing in approx. 60 days.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Fredrickson.  Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  Defendant stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently, freely and voluntarily,  waived his right to a preliminary hearing.
